definition: to take part in/to participate/to join/to attend/to counsel/unequal/varied/irregular/uneven/not uniform/abbr. for 參議院|参议院 Senate, Upper House
to patronize/to support/to praise/(Internet slang) to like (an online post on Facebook etc)

sentences.english: Counselor Yao Wenliang and Consul Li Zhuang from the Chinese Consulate General were present.
sentences.chinese: 使馆参赞尧文良和领事李壮等在座。

sentences.english: He is currently Minister Counsellor at the Chinese Mission to the United Nations in Geneva.
sentences.chinese: 他目前在中国常驻日内瓦代表团担任公使衔参赞。

sentences.english: Counsellor Yao Wenliang and Consul Li Zhuang from the Chinese Consulate General were present.
sentences.chinese: 使馆参赞尧文良和领事李壮等陪同。

sentences.english: The Economic and Commercial Counsellor's Office of the Embassy of the People's Republ…
sentences.chinese: 中华人民共和国驻南非共和国大使馆经济商务参赞处。

sentences.english: For the sake of convenience, you may contact our Commercial Counsellors' Office in your country for this matter.
sentences.chinese: 为方便起见，可请径与我国驻贵国的商务参赞处联系。

sentences.english: Counselor Miao Deyu also responded to questions raised by reporters.
sentences.chinese: 苗得雨参赞还回答了与会记者提出的问题。

sentences.english: The reception was chaired by Mr. Li Bijian, Counsellor of the Embassy.
sentences.chinese: 招待会由李碧建参赞主持。

definition: minister/diplomat performing ambassadorial role in Qing times, before regular diplomatic relations
Ministry of Foreign Affairs in Qing Dynasty
